meanings.definition: A fatal flaw leading to the downfall of a tragic hero.
meanings.sent1: The hamartia of the main character was his inability to trust others.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the hamartia of the hero was his excessive pride.
meanings.sent3: The hamartia of the hero made the audience gasp in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: Her hamartia was like a dark shadow following her every move.
meanings.sent5: The hamartia of the protagonist was his downfall in the end.

meanings.definition: The tragic flaw or error of judgment that leads to the protagonist's downfall in a tragedy.
meanings.sent1: Without his hamartia, the story would have had a different ending.
meanings.sent2: The hamartia of the character was his inability to forgive.
meanings.sent3: Her hamartia led to unexpected twists in the plot.
meanings.sent4: The hamartia of the protagonist was like a ticking time bomb.
meanings.sent5: The hamartia of the hero was the key to the tragic outcome.
